function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Spread of covid-19 due to lack of multi-disciplinary collaboration","Privacy and security risks in cloud-assisted wastewater management system","Spread of water-borne diseases due to ineffective water quality management","Use of predictive analytics and machine learning for covid-19 prediction","Application of ai in covid-19 diagnosis and prediction","Use of blockchain technology for health passports","Use of ai for real-time combat of covid-19","Data mining and analysis for covid-19 monitoring","Real-time surveillance for covid-19 detection","Potential spread of waterborne diseases due to ineffective water management and infrastructure design","Lack of public confidence in water management and safety measures","Ineffective response to pandemic signs and outbreaks","Ineffective and inefficient treatment of wastewater due to change in water pattern and decline in water demand, leading to biosolid deposition, odour, and corrosion.","High concentration of pharmaceutical products in wastewater due to increased demand, posing challenges for old age wastewater treatment plants.","Presence of sars-cov-2 in wastewater from covid-19 patients, highlighting the risk of spreading the virus through inadequate treatment.","Potential contamination of reagents and probes","Poor predictive accuracy of model selection","Digital revolution vulnerabilities","Using arima model for covid-19 prediction and forecasting","Quantifying sar-cov-2 infectiousness using contact tracing","Cost analysis of wbe and clinical screening","Complex model evaluation may lead to inaccuracies in covid-19 predictions","Inadequate consideration of vaccination and immunity rates in the model","Lack of consideration for behavioral and social factors impacting disease spread","Complex model representation may lead to misunderstanding or misinterpretation.","Lack of clarity around model variables and equations may hinder effective analysis and decision-making.","Spread of sar-cov-2 in a smart city due to transmission dynamics and multiple dimensions of the disease","Possibility of re-infection and loss of immunity over time","Undetected infected persons contributing to disease spread","Incomplete assessment of sars-cov-2 prevalence in wastewater may lead to underestimation of infection rates","Uncertainty in decay rate calculations may result in inaccurate estimation of virus survivability in wastewater","Inaccurate modeling of virus spreading in smart cities may lead to ineffective pandemic control measures","Analysis of antimicrobial resistance genes args in influent’s wastewater using qpcr technology.","Privacy issues in wastewater-based epidemiology wbe , leading to potential stigmatization in certain communities.","Challenges in wbe surveillance of water and wastewater concerning covid-19, including the non-existence of biomarkers discovery pipeline, accounting for population size fluctuations, need for biomarker extraction technology, and lack of analytical tools.","Large-scale population surveillance may lead to privacy concerns and data misuse.","Reliance on wastewater surveillance may lead to complacency in individual testing and personal hygiene.","Inability to identify specific infected individuals and locations may result in ineffective contact tracing and targeted containment measures.","Presence of sars-cov-2 in hospital water, tap water, and domestic sewage","Persistence of sars-cov-2 at low temperatures and in urine and stools","Decreasing efficacy of disinfectant techniques in wastewater","Inadequate wastewater treatment leading to presence of enveloped and non-enveloped pathogens in the water system","Presence of enveloped viruses in the water system due to inadequate treatment","Potential transmission of sars-cov-2 through water systems in developing countries with inadequate treatment infrastructure","Concentration of sars-cov-2 rna in sewage water","Development of rt-qpcr assays for sars-cov-2 rna detection in water","Enveloped and non-enveloped pathogens in the water system","Spread of covid-19 from animal to human","Contaminated wastewater flow to the wastewater treatment plant","Direct consumption of contaminated water by rural and urban communities","Detection of sars-cov-2 genetics in wastewater","Survival of sars-cov-2 in untreated water","Potential contamination of rural and urban water with sars-cov-2","Vulnerability of low-and middle-income countries due to epidemiological factors, transmission challenges, and high demand for the health system.","Contaminated wastewater as a source of disease spread.","Transmission of sars-cov-2 through respiratory droplets and contaminated surfaces","High cost of contact tracking, testing, and isolation","Potential risk of covid-19 in untreated drinking water and wastewater","Incomplete context for numerical values","Data entry errors"],"non-risks":["Spread of covid-19 due to lack of multi-disciplinary collaboration","Application of ai in covid-19 diagnosis and prediction","Use of predictive analytics and machine learning for covid-19 prediction","Use of ai for real-time combat of covid-19","Digital revolution vulnerabilities","Using arima model for covid-19 prediction and forecasting","Quantifying sar-cov-2 infectiousness using contact tracing","Inadequate consideration of vaccination and immunity rates in the model","Undetected infected persons contributing to disease spread","Data entry errors"]}
